subject: Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
msgSnippet: Hi! Thanks for this, I found it yesterday evening! :-) In my version, I have a single instance of the RunListener but everything else is similar. For people
messageBody:
Hi!

Thanks for this, I found it yesterday evening! :-)

In my version, I have a single instance of the RunListener but
everything else is similar.

For people who don't know how to use a custom runner, you have to
write an annotation @RunWith(TestClassRunner.class) at the start of
your test classes.

Best regards,
Anthony


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Chris Jepeway" <Chris.Jepeway@...> wrote:
>
> You've gotta subclass TestClassRunner, I think.
>
> See
>
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/18728
>
> I think we had to tweak that code a bit for some
> later versions of JUnit 4, but you'll get an idea
> in that msg of one approach that works.
>
> Chris.
> --
> Chris Jepeway
> Jewelry Television
>
